preamble.english: And offer supplication following every obligatory prayer, saying:

phrases.english: The One like unto Whom there is nothing.
And He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.
And this is a month which You have exalted and honored,
phrases.transliteration: Wa hādhā shahrun ʿaẓẓamtahu wa karramtahu,

phrases.english: And You have ennobled it and favored it above all months,

phrases.arabic: وَهُوَ الشَّهْرُ الَّذى فَرَضْتَ صِيامَهُ عَلَىَّ،
phrases.english: And it is the month, the fasting of which You have made obligatory upon me,
And it is the month of Ramadan,
in which You revealed the Qur’an,

phrases.arabic: هُدًى لِلنَّاسِ وَبَيِّناتٍ مِنَ الْهُدى وَالْفُرْقانِ،
phrases.english: A guidance for mankind and clear proofs of guidance and the criterion.
phrases.transliteration: Hudan lin-nāsi wa bayyinātin minal-hudā wal-furqān,

phrases.english: And You have placed therein the Night of Decree,
And You have made it better than a thousand months,
phrases.transliteration: wa ja‘altahā khayran min alfi shahrin.

phrases.arabic: فَيا ذَا الْمَنِّ وَلا يُمَنُّ عَلَيْكَ،
phrases.english: O Bestower of favors, upon Whom no favor can be bestowed,

phrases.arabic: مُنَّ عَلَىَّ بِفَكاكِ رَقَبَتى مِنَ النَّارِ،
phrases.english: Bestow Your favor upon me by freeing my neck from the Fire.
Among those upon whom You bestow Your favor,
By Your mercy, O Most Merciful of the merciful.
